unnormalised: Property registrations in Mumbai saw a 15% YoY increase in Oct '24, according to a report by Knight Frank. Approx. 11,500 units were registered compared to 10,000 in Oct '23. This surge is attributed to festive season offers and stable interest rates. Experts say that property prices in prime locations such as Bandra and Juhu have seen a rise of 5-7% in the last 6 months.
normalised: property registrations in Mumbai saw a fifteen percent year over year increase in October twenty twenty four, according to a report by Knight Frank. Approximately eleven thousand five hundred units were registered compared to ten thousand in October twenty twenty three. This surge is attributed to festive season offers and stable interest rates. Experts say that property prices in prime locations such as Bandra and Juhu have seen a rise of five to seven percent in the last six months.

unnormalised: The average property price in Mumbai is currently around ₹2.5 crores. However, properties in South Mumbai can easily cost upwards of ₹5 crores. The stamp duty and registration charges are an additional 6% of the property value. For example, on a property worth ₹1 crore, you'd pay an additional ₹6 lakh.
normalised: The average property price in Mumbai is currently around rupee two point five crores. However, properties in South Mumbai can easily cost upwards of rupee five crores. The stamp duty and registration charges are an additional six percent of the property value. For example, on a property worth rupee one crore, you would pay an additional rupee six lakh.

unnormalised: Analysts also noted a significant increase in the sale of 2BHK and 3BHK flats, accounting for 60% of the total sales. Developers are focusing on launching projects that cater to the mid-segment and premium housing categories. Several new projects are planned for areas like Thane West and Panvel in the coming months.
normalised: Analysts also noted a significant increase in the sale of two B-H-K and three B-H-K flats, accounting for sixty percent of the total sales. Developers are focusing on launching projects that cater to the mid-segment and premium housing categories. Several new projects are planned for areas like Thane West and Panvel in the coming months.

unnormalised: It's important to remember that property investment involves several costs besides the basic agreement value. These include registration charges, stamp duty which currently stands at 5% in Maharashtra, brokerage fees (typically around 1-2% of property cost), and legal fees that can amount to approximately Rs 25,000.
normalised: It is important to remember that property investment involves several costs besides the basic agreement value. These include registration charges, stamp duty which currently stands at five percent in Maharashtra, brokerage fees (typically around one to two percent of property cost), and legal fees that can amount to approximately rupees twenty five thousand.

unnormalised: Potential home buyers are advised to conduct thorough due diligence before investing. This includes verifying property documents, checking for encumbrances, and understanding the terms and conditions of the sale agreement. Consult with a real estate agent or legal expert for assistance.
normalised: Potential home buyers are advised to conduct thorough due diligence before investing. This includes verifying property documents, checking for encumbrances, and understanding the terms and conditions of the sale agreement. Consult with a real estate agent or legal expert for assistance.
